item.title: Update with two tables
item.description: Sometimes it is useful to update one table based on associated data found in a second table. It is easy to accidentally affect all rows because the update syntax does not have the JOIN ... USING (some_id) phrase that you would usually use to restrict rows by id. -- Often not what you intend! -- Affects all rows because the where clause evaluates to true. update foo f set is_active = false from bar b where b.
